results.title: Metformin ameliorates the status epilepticus- induced hippocampal pathology through possible mTOR modulation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ ameliorates the @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@- induced hippocampal pathology through possible @GENE_MTOR @GENE_56718 @@@mTOR@@@ modulation.

citations.NLM: Bojja SL, Medhi B, Anand S, Bhatia A, Joshi R, Minz RW. Metformin ameliorates the status epilepticus- induced hippocampal pathology through possible mTOR modulation. Inflammopharmacology. 2021 Feb;29(1):137-151. PMID: 33386490
citations.BibTeX: @article{33386490, title={Metformin ameliorates the status epilepticus- induced hippocampal pathology through possible mTOR modulation.}, author={Bojja SL and Medhi B and Anand S and Bhatia A and Joshi R and Minz RW}, journal={Inflammopharmacology}, volume={29}, number={1}, pages={137-151}}

results.title: Drug repurposing in status epilepticus.
results.text_hl: Combining AI and in silico approaches has identified several candidate drugs, including @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@sirolimus@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Riluzole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019782 @@@riluzole@@@, for @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Walker MC. Drug repurposing in status epilepticus. Epilepsy Behav. 2024 Oct 27;161():110109. PMID: 39467455
citations.BibTeX: @article{39467455, title={Drug repurposing in status epilepticus.}, author={Walker MC}, journal={Epilepsy Behav}, volume={161}, pages={110109}}

results.title: Evaluation of the ameliorative effects of oral administration of metformin on epileptogenesis in the temporal lobe epilepsy model in rats.
results.text_hl: KEY FINDINGS: Oral administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ prior to kainite-induced @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ blocked the variant characterizations of epileptogenesis like neuronal cell death, aberrant neurogenesis, mossy fiber sprouting, and spontaneous @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@.

citations.NLM: Vazifehkhah S, Ali MK, Babae JF, Hashemi P, Alireza MS, Nikbakht F. Evaluation of the ameliorative effects of oral administration of metformin on epileptogenesis in the temporal lobe epilepsy model in rats. Life Sci. 2020 Sep 15;257():118066. PMID: 32652135
citations.BibTeX: @article{32652135, title={Evaluation of the ameliorative effects of oral administration of metformin on epileptogenesis in the temporal lobe epilepsy model in rats.}, author={Vazifehkhah S and Ali MK and Babae JF and Hashemi P and Alireza MS and Nikbakht F}, journal={Life Sci}, volume={257}, pages={118066}}

results.title: The possible role of progranulin on anti-inflammatory effects of metformin in temporal lobe epilepsy.
results.text_hl: In sum, we have concluded that @GENE_GRN @GENE_29143 @@@progranulin@@@ can be a key mediator in @DISEASE_Epilepsy @DISEASE_MESH:D004827 @@@epilepsy@@@, and the anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ action of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ is through increasing the secretion of @GENE_IL10 @GENE_25325 @@@IL-10@@@ and inhibiting @GENE_IL1B @GENE_24494 @@@IL-1 beta@@@ and @DISEASE_Gliosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrogliosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Vazifehkhah S, Khanizadeh AM, Mojarad TB, Nikbakht F. The possible role of progranulin on anti-inflammatory effects of metformin in temporal lobe epilepsy. J Chem Neuroanat. 2020 Nov;109():101849. PMID: 32679167
citations.BibTeX: @article{32679167, title={The possible role of progranulin on anti-inflammatory effects of metformin in temporal lobe epilepsy.}, author={Vazifehkhah S and Khanizadeh AM and Mojarad TB and Nikbakht F}, journal={J Chem Neuroanat}, volume={109}, pages={101849}}

results.title: Effect of solid lipid nanoparticles loaded with valproate and metformin on pentylenetetrazole-induced epilepsy in rats.
results.text_hl: Recent studies show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ activates @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@, which improves @CHEMICAL_Lithium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008094 @@@lithium@@@- and @CHEMICAL_Pilocarpine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010862 @@@pilocarpine@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Abinaya R, Kalaichelvan VK, Gopalasatheeskumar K. Effect of solid lipid nanoparticles loaded with valproate and metformin on pentylenetetrazole-induced epilepsy in rats. Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol. 2025 Mar 5;():. PMID: 40042558
citations.BibTeX: @article{40042558, title={Effect of solid lipid nanoparticles loaded with valproate and metformin on pentylenetetrazole-induced epilepsy in rats.}, author={Abinaya R and Kalaichelvan VK and Gopalasatheeskumar K}, journal={Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol}}

results.title: The effect of metformin treatment on endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress induced by status epilepticus (SE) via the PERK-eIF2alpha-CHOP pathway.
results.text_hl: The effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment on endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress induced by @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@) via the PERK-@GENE_EIF2A @GENE_502531 @@@eIF2alpha@@@-@GENE_DDIT3 @GENE_29467 @@@CHOP@@@ pathway.

citations.NLM: Chen J, Zheng G, Guo H, Shi ZN, Jiang J, Wang XY, Yang X, Liu XY. The effect of metformin treatment on endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress induced by status epilepticus (SE) via the PERK-eIF2alpha-CHOP pathway. Bosn J Basic Med Sci. 2018 Feb 20;18(1):49-54. PMID: 28686850

results.title: Evaluation of metformin effects in the chronic phase of spontaneous seizures in pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy.
results.text_hl: At 45 day after induction of @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was injected intraperitoneally in dose of 250 mg/kg/day for 5 days.

citations.NLM: Mehrabi S, Sanadgol N, Barati M, Shahbazi A, Vahabzadeh G, Barzroudi M, Seifi M, Gholipourmalekabadi M, Golab F. Evaluation of metformin effects in the chronic phase of spontaneous seizures in pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy. Metab Brain Dis. 2018 Feb;33(1):107-114. PMID: 29080083
